Problem:
Consider a system where a complex function \\(z(t) = x(t) + iy(t)\\) undergoes a transformation \\(f(z) = e^{At}z\\), where A is a constant complex number. The function influences the trajectory over time t.

If \\(f(z)\\) is initially applied to a complex number \\(z_0\\) and the system then evolves according to \\(\\dot{z} = Bz\\), where B is another constant complex number, will \\(z(T)\\) at time T be equivalent to simply evolving \\(z_0\\) under \\(\\dot{z} = Bz\\) for the same duration?
Explanation: Applying the transformation \\(f(z)\\) initially modifies \\(z_0\\) into \\(e^{At}z_0\\), changing the starting point of the evolution under \\(\\dot{z} = Bz\\). This difference in initial conditions generally leads to a different trajectory and endpoint, dependent on both A and B.
